document.masterDocTitle: New species and new records of scaphopods from New Caledonia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and new records of scaphopods from New Caledonia
Mémoires du Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle

subSubSection.paragraph:
Laevidentalium houbricki Scarabino, 1995: 295
, figs 100, 102d. Material cited: 3 lots (20 spms) from eastern New Caledonia , live in
150- 220 m
.

Laevidentalium arnoldi Lamprell & Healy, 1998: 111
, figs 112B, 113D, 116. ( new synonym ).

TYPE MATERIAL EXAMINED. —
Laevidentalium arnoldi
: holotype QM MO53676
.

TYPE LOCALITY. —
Off Cairns , northern Queensland , Australia , 17°22’S , 146°48’E ,
303 m
.

-

DISTRIBUTION. —
Global distribution: Indonesia , northern Australia (as
L. arnoldi
) and New Caledonia . Distribution in the New Caledonian region : north: Grand Passage ; most of the eastern area of New Caledonia proper; southwestern and southern regions, off Ile des Pins ; live in
150-577 m
, shells down to
650 m
.

REMARKS. — Comparison of the type material of
L. arnoldi
and
L. houbricki
confirmed their resemblance in form and in transverse section, and the presence in some specimens of a short apical pipe.
